cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 205 miles ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Slowing while tracking northwest toward the North Carolina coast, then turning west-northwest and drifting west-southwest across eastern South Carolina through the weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern North Carolina coast (near Cape Fear-Surf City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC; Storm Surge Watch north of Duck NC to NC/VA border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds; Tropical Storm Warning north of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA and Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact along North & South Carolina coasts with tropical-storm conditions extending into southeastern Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small (≤4%) chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; sustained gales unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat for upper Chesapeake Bay; only minor tidal rises possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: Occasional rain bands may reach Maryland Friday–Saturday with totals generally 1-3 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and long-period swells could disrupt vessel approaches and create dangerous rip currents along Maryland beaches.
